etymology.description: semantic: 阜 + phonetic: 可 (OC *qaːl; 可 OC *kʰaːlʔ); originally ‘big mound’.
etymology.interpretation: Built with 阜 ‘mound’ conveying the idea of a landform, while 可 supplies the pronunciation. Its earliest sense was ‘large mound,’ later borrowed for phonetic use, giving rise to modern functions like a name/kinship prefix and in transliterations.

examples.chinese: 她是阿明的姐姐(她是阿明的姐姐)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì Ā Míng de jiějie.

examples.chinese: 孩子们都叫她阿姨(孩子們都叫她阿姨)。
examples.english: The children all call her A-yi (auntie).

examples.chinese: 我们学习阿拉伯文化(我們學習阿拉伯文化)。
